title: Jewish Encyclopedia (2007, PDF) People - Culture - History
description:
The 'Encyclopaedia Judaica' consists of 22 PDF files 
and somewhere in the area of 15,000 pages. It is a 
good reference for most things if you want a quick 
brief on Jewish topics. 
Each article ends with a bibliographical note (further 
reading references like books or other sources). 
The text of a volume can be searched with the search 
option in Acrobat Reader. 

Of course, as is often the case with long running 
encyclopedias (this one was started in Germany in the 
late 1920ies) they tend to be slightly conservative. 
For instance the "hot potatoe" issue of revising 
the history of Israel's founding in 1948 (connected 
with the movement of the "New Historians" and "Post-
Zionism") is not mentioned in a seperate article, 
nor any the individual new historians themselves (Benny 
Morris, Ilan Pappe, Avi Shlaim, Tom Segev). 

With some heavy competion from online sources like 
Wikipedia and Wikisources which are expanding daily 
this encyclopedia faces an uphill battle.
